commands.description: Create a new project from a boilerplate.

attributes.description: The afterbegin attribute inserts text, before its first child.
The afterend attribute inserts text after the element itself.
The alert attribute displays an alert box with a specified message.
The beforebegin attribute inserts text before the element itself.
The beforeend attribute inserts text, before its last child.
The lowercase attribute converts a string to lowercase letters.
The slice attribute cuts a portion of the string, starting at the specified index and extending for a given number of characters afterwards.
The trim attribute removes whitespace from both sides of a string.
The uppercase attribute converts a string to uppercase letters.

elements.description: The title element sets the document's title that is shown in a browser's title bar or a page's tab.

variables.description: The baseUrl variable prints out the current configured base URL.
The currentEnvName variable prints out the current environment name.
The currentEnvUrl variable prints out the current environment path.
The currentPage variable prints out the current path and filename of the current page.
The currentScriptUrl variable prints out the current location in which Front runs.
The currentUrl variable prints out the current URL location in which Front runs.
The debugMode variable prints out whether debug mode is on or off.
The hostName variable prints out the name of the internet host of the current page.
The mobileMode variable prints out whether the current running device is a mobile device or not.
The startPage variable prints out the default configured start page.
